newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Netanyahu, Arafat commit to peacemaking.
newsitem.headline: Netanyahu, Arafat commit to peacemaking.

text.p: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Palestinian President Yasser Arafat said after meeting for the first time on Wednesday they were committed to making peace.

"I would like to emphasise once again our commitment to cooperation with Israel, our commitment to all aspects of the agreement with Israel in accordance with agreements signed," Arafat told a news conference after an hour-long meeting.
"Both parties reiterate their commitment to the interim agreement and their determination to carry out its implementation," Netanyahu said.

But he added: "We have to take into account the needs and requirements of both sides on the basis of reciprocity and the assurance of the security and well-being of both Israelis and Palestinians alike."
Netanyahu said Israel and the Palestinians wanted to "advance the issues of concern to all of us."
